issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: If account aliases are validated then the validation should be updated for EUCA-10566 to disallow use of aliases consisting of 12 digits such as "123456789012".
fields.summary: Disallow use of account alias with 12 digits

comments.body: account creation is done when you log in as admin@eucalyptus only.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1552
reassigning to [~lnajjar] since my setup is fubar and i can't reach ufshost and don't want to hold up 4.2

If we are trying to prevent users from entering their account numbers as their account names, then perhaps we should test against only their 12-digit account numbers instead of giving an error for ANY 12-digit account number.

[~jloza], what do you think? Can we ask the submitter to refine this bug report? Could we also display an error message that describes why the error is being displayed and what the user can do to fix the error?
It's any 12-digit number that should be disallowed, not a specific one.

[~jloza], OK. Any 12-digit number produces an error.

What do you think about refining the error message so the user knows what to fix? 

Current error message:  _Account names must be between 3 and 63 characters long, and may contain lower case letters, numbers, '.'. '@' and '-', and cannot contain spaces._

Proposed error message: _Account names must be between 3 and 63 characters long, and may contain lower case letters, numbers, '.'. '@' and '-', and cannot contain spaces. To avoid re-using account numbers, 12-digit account names are not allowed._
or just "Account names must be between 3 and 63 (but not exactly 12) characters long, and may contain lower case letters, numbers, '.'. '@' and '-', and cannot contain spaces."
Better. But the ticket says 12 digits are unacceptable. So, 12 alphanumerics should work.
[~ashamblin], rejecting patch because of account name validation errors you identified.
Please see updated validation error message.  Also, when the account name entered does consist of 12 digits, the Create Account button is disabled (no longer clickable, color changes.)
Error message does not appear below the entry field when the user tabs out after entering invalid characters.

[~ashamblin] made a fix (submit button stays unavailable) that complies with the strict interpretation of this ticket.

During UX verification review, [~lnajjar] and [~ashamblin] found some odd field verification behaviors that extend beyond this ticket. For example, for account Name the invalid entry error message does not appear below the field. To improve the user experience, [~ashamblin] is investigating how field verification works here and hopes to make an improvement.

[~lnajjar], [~ashamblin], if [~ashamblin] is the dev on this ticket it shouldn't be assigned to him **and** in review. Not sure what the correct state should be for this ticket. If it's ready for review, it should be assigned to a reviewer. If [~ashamblin] is working on it, it should be to-do or in progress. 

Please update when y'all can! Thanks.
[~jloza], I am unable to move the ticket from "In Review" to "In Progress."
[~lnajjar], if Adam needs to do more work, just reject patch. That will send it to either in progress or to do.
The entry verifications for the account name field do not appear below the field when needed by users.
Could you please fix the validation error not appearing below the account Name field?
Let's give this one more go!
[~ashamblin], and is the pull request 1688?

Verified on Macintosh running Chrome 45.0.2454.85 (64-bit), Firefox 40.0.3, and Safari 8.0.7.

Great job going above and beyond to take care of our users, [~ashamblin]!

UX review passed. Ready for code review.
PR 1552 merged

Verified.  12 digit numbers are rejected.
